{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine if ALVAC-HIV was effective for HIV prevention in the HVTN 702 trial, we need to review the results of the trial. The HVTN 702 trial was a large-scale HIV vaccine efficacy trial conducted in South Africa. It aimed to evaluate the safety and efficacy of a vaccine regimen consisting of ALVAC-HIV and a protein subunit vaccine. The trial enrolled HIV-negative adults at high risk of acquiring HIV. The participants were randomly assigned to receive either the vaccine regimen or a placebo. The primary endpoint of the trial was the prevention of HIV infection.
